body_html: This is different. The socket module is pretty much a direct wrapper around the C API, and you really need to understand pretty much most of the ops it prints to do anything with sockets. Autograd is different. Most users don't really know or even should now how it works under the hood, and directly showing grad_fn is something that is very internal. If the problem is that "leaf" is not a widely recognized name, can we make it has_grad_fn=True?
body_text: This is different. The socket module is pretty much a direct wrapper around the C API, and you really need to understand pretty much most of the ops it prints to do anything with sockets. Autograd is different. Most users don't really know or even should now how it works under the hood, and directly showing grad_fn is something that is very internal. body: This is different. The `socket` module is pretty much a direct wrapper around the C API, and you really need to understand pretty much most of the ops it prints to do anything with sockets. Autograd is different. Most users don't really know or even should now how it works under the hood, and directly showing `grad_fn` is something that is very internal. If the problem is that "leaf" is not a widely recognized name, can we make it `has_grad_fn=True`?
